news.description: One paper about multi-armed bandit ensemble recommendation has been accepted by Recsys 2014.

One paper about large-scale data mining application in manufacturing industry and one paper about real time contextual collective anomaly detection have been accepted by KDD 2014 and its workshop Outlier Detection & Description under Data Diversity respectively.
Elected as the PMC member of Apache Hama.
One paper about ad-hoc event summarization has been accepted by SDM 2014.
Contributed the online learning version of multilayer perceptron to Apache Mahout. It will appear in the next major release. Please use it and give me comments/feedback/bug report :)
Received the 2014 summer intenship offer from Facebook.
Finished the internship at IBM T. J Watson Research Center.
Voted as a committer at Apache Hama for my contribution to the distributed machine learning package.
Start the internship at IBM T. J Watson Research Center.
One demo paper about distributed data mining systems has been accepted by KDD 2013.
One paper about improving cloud service quality via resource prediction has been accepted by IEEE Transactions on Network and Service Management
One paper about dynamic query form has been accepted by IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering.
Finished the internship at IBM T. J Watson Research Center.
Start the internship at IBM T. J Watson Research Center.

industrial.institution: Facebook Inc - Public Content Team

work.description: Participated in the design and implementation of personal news feed ranking system.

industrial.institution: IBM T.J Watson Research Center - Enterprise Cloud Engineering Group

work.description: Participated in the design and implementation of an intelligent tool that leverages the data mining techniques to improve the efficiency for both the customers and server providers to conduct the server configuration.

industrial.institution: IBM T.J Watson Research Center - Cloud Platform Technologies Group

work.description: Participated in the design and development of a prototype project called Cloud Services Marketplace. The goal of this project is to provide an intelligent platform to facilitate the customers for service acquisition. The prototype evolved into IBM 2013 Global Technology Outlook project 'Scalable Services Ecosystem'.

industrial.institution: IBM T.J Watson Research Center - Service Management Environment Group

work.description: This project focused on cloud capacity prediction, one of the emerging problems by which the cloud service providers are concerned. We proposed an integrated solution of intelligent cloud capacity estimation for the IBM Smart Cloud Enterprise (SCE) to reduce the unnecessary energy consumption.

The promise of cloud computing is to provide computing resources instantly whenever they are needed. The state-of-the-art virtual machine (VM) provisioning technology can provision a VM in tens of minutes. This latency may be satisfiable for non-urgent jobs but it is unacceptable for jobs that need to scale out during computation. We designed an online temporal data mining system for modeling and predicting the cloud VM demand, then provision VMs in advance.

industrial.institution: Microsoft Research Asia - Data Intelligence and Tools Group (DIT)

work.topic: Large-scale Usage Behavior Analysis for Office User
work.description: Developed a frequent sequence mining algorithm based on distributed system, and applied it to analyze the Office user behavior dataset to discover causal knowledge about the how different users use the Office software. The mining result is used to ameliorate the layout of the GUI of Office series software. In charge of implementation using C++ and parallel version of algorithm design.

This is an ongoing project. Its goal is to design and implement a tool to monitor the computer cluster in real time. It also aims to incorporate system analytics techniques to facilitate the system management. Project Page at GitHub

This project focuses on facilitating the diagnosis of computer systems based on system logs summarization. We proposed a novel framework called Natural Event Summarization (NES) to summarizes the event log by capturing the temporal pattern among events. Given the system log, NES is able to discovery the multi-party relationships among events and facilitate the analytic tasks of the system administrators. Paper

This project focuses on facilitating complicated query tasks for users. We proposed a query system that is convenient for non-expert user to query information from semi-structured data. The system is able to dynamically generate query form that satisfy the potential requirement of the users by inferencing the intention of the users during interaction. Paper

academic.institution: Sichuan University - Database and Knowledge Engineering Lab (DBKE)

work.topic: Knowledge Discovery and Data Visualization of Serious Birth Defects
work.description: Research on discovery knowledge from the data of new-born (The real dataset got from all hospitals throughout China, spanned from 1986 to 1993) with birth defects, the works include: (1) Find out which reason cause a particular defect. (2) Find out possible way of decreasing the birth defect rate. (3) Visualize the data to enable the users understand the result more easily.

work.topic: WTSBMiner: Web Tag and Social Bookmark Miner
work.description: This project aims at analyzing the Social Networks through a famous site 'http://del.cio.us'. We model the social network on 'delicious' as a kind of tripartite graph by treating 'tag', 'user' and 'URL' as three different kinds of nodes, and then we conduct the analysis on this heterogenous graph.

review: IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering

list.title: Machine Learning package of Apache Hama
list.description: This is the mirror of the original repository on github. I am mainly working on the distributed machine learning package for Apache Hama, which is a distributed computing framework based on BSP. Hama is very suitable for large scale iterative algorithms that cannot be efficiently implemented on top of Hadoop .

list.title: Real Time Distributed Monitoring System
list.description: Distributed Real Time Stream Monitoring System is an on going project. Its goal is to design and implement a distributed monitoring system to conduct the continuous monitoring over the computer clusters. This system is design to be in the master/slave mode with two types of slaves: the monitor and collector. The monitor is used to be deployed into the monitored computer node and the collector is used to gather the monitored data. Besides the monitoring, we also intend to add the stream continuous query and the data stream mining modules to the system.

list.title: PDP Workflow Data Stat

list.title: Event Synthetic Data Generator

list.title: Apache Hama
list.description: Apache Hama is a distributed computing framework based on Bulk Synchronous Parallel computing techniques for massive scientific computations e.g., matrix, graph and network algorithms. It's a Top Level Project under the Apache Software Foundation.

list.title: Apache Mahout
list.description: An Apache project to produce free implementations of distributed or otherwise scalable machine learning algorithms on the Hadoop platform.

list.title: Storm
list.description: Storm is a distributed realtime computation system. Similar to how Hadoop provides a set of general primitives for doing batch processing, Storm provides a set of general primitives for doing realtime computation.
